topic.title: Installing and configuring hardware sensors
topic.para: To measure the CPU temperature, install and configure the sensors tool that can access and read the hardware sensors.

step.para: To detect all the sensors in the system, run the following command as &rootuser;:
The --auto option allows checking for all hardware monitoring chips at once without probing them one by one. When finished, the script shows a summary of what chips were detected:
step.screen:
Now follows a summary of the probes I have just done.
Driver `coretemp': * Chip `Intel digital thermal sensor' (confidence: 9)
Driver `to-be-written': * ISA bus, address 0xa40 Chip `ITE IT8686E Super IO Sensors' (confidence: 9)
Do you want to generate /etc/sysconfig/lm_sensors? (YES/no):

step.para: Confirm to generate the file /etc/sysconfig/lm_sensors. After confirmation, the script creates a &systemd; service (/usr/lib/systemd/system/lm_sensors.service.) that is enabled by default.

topic.para: Check the status of the &systemd; service:
topic.screen:

topic.para: After you have completed these steps, your computer has detected all sensors and has started to monitor them.
